turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Neatly said...but to the wrong man. The trouble with pretty girls is that they can't imagine anyone thinking of anything else but the fact they are pretty girls. I get tired of it.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Do you think I don't?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Thanks for the fresh air. That felt good.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: You're sure Mr. Brandon won't mind?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: He doesn't even know half the people who come up to drink his liquor.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Dance?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: No thank you.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: I know it's a littler late for an apology.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Much too late.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Don't take it so big... it isn't a tragedy.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: You said it wasn't a tragedy.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: What's funny about that? If you pick up people like Larry Mitchell other people are bound to get funny ideas about you. The world is full of Larry Mitchells.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: There's one less tonight.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: There isn't one.. That anyone would believe. I went for a walk after dinner, down to the ocean...alone... I came up and went to bed. I didn't sleep very well. Then there was a thunderstorm. And it began to rain. I went across to close the French door. That's the first time I saw him out there.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: He got in here how?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Not with my consent, strange as it seems. I don't know how he got in. I don't know anything.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: No. And I've never fired a gun in my life, Aren't you supposed not to touch it?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Sure... but somebody always does..

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: They'll know whether he killed himself.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I don't.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: How did you meet him?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: On a train. He said he lived here, and he offered to make a reservation for me.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Nice of him.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: He knew the immigration officer. He eased himself in.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: He was a great boy for that. What else?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: That's all there is.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Go ahead...if you want to. It doesn't matter.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: I'd rather wait until it does matter.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: You tried to run away.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: There wasn't any plane.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: It's always a mistake to run away. Always.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Want a spike in it?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: No thanks.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: There's one thing I may as well tell you. You'll find it out anyhow. I tried to run away--when I found him out there on the balcony. There wasn't any plane.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: You didn't have to tell him that.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Bad?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Bad enough.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: He could hardly help suspecting you.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: That's putting it mildly.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: What time is it?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Quarter after one. Why?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: There's a lot of night left to live through.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: So there is. You don't want to go to bed. I don't want to go to bed. Let's go somewhere and hear some music--have something to drink-- something to eat--even dance.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Dance? Tonight?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Let's not pretend Mitchell meant anything to either of us.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Certainly not to me.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Just who are you, anyway?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: You, too?  My name is Betty Mayfield. I was born, and I am here. Message ends. That's what I told him. He didn't like it.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: I'm different. I like it fine.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Cold?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Is this the best you can do?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: At this time of night. It's not as bad as it looks.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Want to dance?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Dance? Here?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: They know you here--know your name.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: I know everybody. I don't look at half of life, just the nice half, I look at all of it.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: That man over there. He was in the hotel lobby.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: I didn't notice him.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: We walked right passed him. He's following us.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Killaine's not that sort of guy. He said no--he meant no.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Then he's got to be a detective.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Couldn't be.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Then he's--

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Quite sure you saw him in the hotel lobby?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Absolutely sure.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: We'll find out.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: He's a fellow with a very hard knee, and he knows how to use it.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: You don't know who he is?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: He's not a cop. A cop wouldn't have kneed me.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: He was following us--but he's not a policeman.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Us?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: All right--following me.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: No matter. There's nothing I can do about it.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Anything I can do about it?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Take me home--and forget you ever saw me. That's a silly remark isn't it?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Try not talking.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: It still doesn't matter if I kiss you?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Nothing matters.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: No use waiting, then.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: That's the second round I've lost tonight.  That fellow hurt me.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: So have I.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: From you, I like it.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: It sounds like a fair location. Could you be a little more exact?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I'm in the Hudson Bay Company's store.  That man last night--the one that followed me--

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: I don't think that's on the market anymore.  I'd like something much closer to the water.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Cant be too close for me.  Right across the street from it suits me.  Anything else listed?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: There's another man--right outside the booth here.  I never saw him Before.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: You're probably mistaken about that.  Let's get together sand talk it over.  There's always a solution to these problems.  But it must be near the water.  Quite near--  Yes, if you don't mind waiting.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I hated to go to that place.  I almost went to the police station instead.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: No percentage in that.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: They're going to arrest me.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: I know.  Killaine has a warrant.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I have my own warrant.  Stop a minute, please.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: If you meant it, you wouldn't show it to me, Betty.  Or am I supposed to deliver it to dear Inspector Killaine?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Wrote it in the waiting room of the Hudson Bay Store.  With somebody's Pekingese trying to climb into my lap.  Perhaps you're right.  Perhaps I didn't mean it. All I know is that I'm licked.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: There's a lot of water between Vancouver and the U.S.A. This note is a suicide note.  After you're gone where would they look for you?  Why would they look for you? Darkness, and open water, and a fast cabin cruiser.  And I have a pocket full of money.  And if I helped you, I'd be committing a crime, or so they tell me.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: That wasn't why I called you.  Why did I hope--when I hadn't any right to hope?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: How bad is it?  Bad enough for--

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Yes.  I've never been very far from it, for a long time.  Will you do something for me?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Take me where I haven't the courage to take myself.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: How bad is the other thing?  The secret?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I was tried for murdering my husband.  Guilty.  The judge set the verdict aside.  There was one man on the jury--  --but he was afraid.  They were all afraid--of my father-in-law. That man followed me last night-- he came from him of course.  My father-in-law will never give up. Never.  He promised me that.  So I came to Vancouver, B.C. As far away as I can get from North Carolina.  And it happens all over again.  Almost the same thing. Almost the same way.  Do you wonder about this--

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: This is the ace, Betty.  But not of spades.  They'll find out about the other.  They might know already. And when they get this--  What would they look for?  Where? Out there somewhere?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: They'll look for you.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: I run over to Victoria.  Play some golf with some people I know.  Do it all the time.  That's why I have a cabin cruiser.  Custom- built.Forty knots.  Mr Clark Brandon an almost gentleman of almost complete leisure.  Member of six golf clubs.  Broke 70 once on the Shaughnessy Heights Course.  You have to be good to do that, And if you look out of a front window of the Empress Hotel in Victoria, in a few hours you can look right down on Mr. Brandon's boat, the Valkyrie.  Came alone?  Sure.  He always comes alone.  Mr Brandon's a rather lonely man.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: And Betty Mayfield--

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Blonde, beautiful, and sad--and nowhere.  Of course she might have run away--if she knew how.  And where to go.  She might have dyed her hair.  Bleached it before probably.  And changed her name again.  But look at this note.  And look at her room in the hotel. Her stuff is all there.  Hasn't a rag except what she stood up in. You don't run away like that.  Not if you are young and beautiful. No chance.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: But that's what I'm doing.  Couldn't they think of that?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: If they had any reason to.  Why make it tough for themselves?  Why go to all that trouble?  Here's an open book.  Close it.  No reason to keep it open.  She was a nice girl, anyway.  And perhaps she didn't kill him on purpose.  Perhaps she didn't kill the other one. You never know.  Give her the benefit of the doubt.  Leave her stay where she is.  Close the book. Finis.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Killaine...

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: The best interference runner we've got.  He thinks he's in love with you--and he's a gentleman.  Come here, baby.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: You'll be safe here.  I won't be long.  Help yourself to anything you want. The galley's through there.  You can make coffee if you like.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: This must have cost a fortune.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: It did, but it never paid off-- until now.  I ought to be back within an hour. We can't leave until near dark anyway.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Do you have to leave the note?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: It's the frame on the picture. But not if you say so.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: I'd still go through--even if I ended up in jail.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: You wouldn't like it.  I've been there.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: My father died in jail, and he was twice the man I am.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Well?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: You leave it.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Killaine's wise.  We can't wait any longer.  Here, put this on.  But stay out of sight until we clear the harbor.  I'll tell you when.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Killaine's wise to what?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: See anything?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I can still see the shoreline. The moon is rising.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: There would be a moon tonight.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Cold?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Frozen.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Go down into the cabin and get yourself a drink.  Careful how you go, we're hitting the swell now.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I decided I didn't want a drink...I'm beginning to wonder.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Wonder what?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: If you're doing all this just for me.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: That, and the fun of it.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I thought you had to be back to the hotel.  To leave my--my note.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Funny, I never thought of you that way.  You were so close too.  We were all pretty stupid about you.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Including Killaine.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Including Killaine...I still can't think of you that way.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: I told you my father died in jail. He stole a fortune.  Most of it pretty dirty money.  I don't care to have that known.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Larry Mitchell found out.  So you killed him.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: In a way.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: If it was an accident, you could have told the truth.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: So could you.  But our records were a little against us.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: What your father did doesn't condemn you.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Nobody believed I wasn't in on it. I was just a dumb-smart collage boy, and he was my father.  I thought it was a legitimate business.  He was a politician, with fingers in a lot of pies.  I never saw the pies.  They had names. For the record.  Innocent names.  You know where that kind of money comes from, don't you?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: The money that makes you Mr. Clark Brandon.  Let's you live in a penthouse, on top of the Vancouver Royal.  Lets you own a cruiser. Lets you do as you please, go where you please.  You big, open-handed, generous guy.  That's the kind of money it takes, isn't it?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: It buys things, just like any other kind.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: That man that was following us last night--he didn't come back this morning.  I'm beginning to wonder about him, too.  Was he really following me--or you?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: No.  I paid him off.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: He'll come back...They always come back when you give them money.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Not this one.  And not Mitchell.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: You-killed-him?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Magruder obliged me.  No use my saying it wasn't planned that way. I had to clean up.  I'm not a dumb- smart college boy anymore.  Nobody in the world would believe I didn't plan the whole thing.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I guess I'm a little screwy.  Maybe I could believe it.  Should I try?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Don't go soft on me, baby.  I've got your note in my pocket.  You wrote it, all by your own self. And I have to use it.  It has to be found in exactly the right place.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: So that I will never be found.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: You'll never make it.  You've out- smarted yourself.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: I'm still on course to Victoria. Nobody saw you get on board, nobody seen you since.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: It wasn't the time or place.  Don't worry about the note, baby.  I'm playing for my neck now.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: And I'm begging for my life--and yours.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Mine?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Yes.  Yours.  You haven't murdered anybody.  You killed Mitchell. Wasn't that an accident?  It must have been.  If you kill a blackmailer, you kill him dead--so that he can't talk anymore.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Mitchell was dead enough.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: And that nasty man that followed us last night.  You didn't kill him.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Who'd believe it but you?  I took him out to sea and threw him in the water.  Even if they find him, what connects him with me?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Magruder does.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: You think Magruder wants to hang beside me?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: But the next one is murder.  First the little step, then the longer step , and then the step you can never take back.  You could tell about Mitchell.  You could tell about Magruder--and the detective. It would hurt, but you could do it.  You could never tell about me.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Would I want to?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Every day of your life you'll want me.  You'll never get over it. Every time you see your face in the mirror--

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Shut up!  Cut it out!  Even if I have to kill both of us--

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: This is it, Betty.  They'll find us again, fog or no fog.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: If it has to be--do you mind if I do it myself?  Oh, I don't mean with the gun. This is no trick.  When I wrote that note you have in your pocket-- that was no trick either.  It's not so hard for me as you think. I'm not crying about it, I've been skating close to it for quite some time.  The water is cold down there--  But so is everything else.  And there's you.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Me?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Yes.  You.  You're not really a murderer yet.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: I think you mean that.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Do you think I was faking?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: If I did-I don't-now.

turns.speaker: WAITER
turns.text: Yes, Miss.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I'd like a dry Martini. Very dry, please.

turns.speaker: WAITER
turns.text: Sorry, Miss. Beer and ale only. Canadian law.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Beer?  Well, all right.

turns.speaker: WAITER
turns.text: Beer or ale, Miss?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Ale. I don't mind.

turns.speaker: WAITER
turns.text: Right, Miss.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: Mrs. West is a very emotional woman.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I don't know her.. or particularly want to.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: You probably know the type. You find them in hotels and resorts all over the world. They always have clothes, and money, and usually have had three or four husbands. They dress and enamel themselves with great care. They worry a great deal about those little lines at the corner of the eyes.. And they demonstrate their incompetence at the art of living bet getting mixed up with people like Larry Mitchell.  Tell me about yourself, Miss Mayfield.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I was born in New York City. I grew up. And here I am.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: I'll have to know a little more than that.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I'm sorry, that's all there is.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: Miss Mayfield, the humor of the situation escapes me. Within 24 hours I shall know officially whether Mitchell was murdered. Privately, I'm quite sure of it now. It happened in your room, and you came to Vancouver with him.. At any rate, he made your hotel reservation.. And you arrived together. Here in this room he behaved nastily to you, and you said something to him which might be taken as a threat.  A few hours later he was found dead on your balcony. Would it be too much too suggest that all these circumstances taken together are a little suspicious?

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: Please answer my question.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: You didn't ask a question. You made a speech.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: That's an evasion and you know it.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: It is?

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: Well, that's not getting us anywhere. You won't tell me who you are, or give any account of yourself. You won't even give me your address in the United States. Why? Unhappy marriage?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Who told you I was married?

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: There's the clear mark of a wedding ring on your finger.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Your family coat of arms, Mr. Killaine?

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: Regimental! Seaforth Highlanders.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: Stop saying you're sorry. I want information, not regrets.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Would you be satisfied if I said I shot him?

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: What this?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: Where's you get it?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: A graduation present.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: An unhappy marriage hardly seems a sufficient reason for that.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Why don't you arrest me and be done with it.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: I probably shall--after I've tortured you a little more.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Good morning, Mr. Killaine. I'm sorry I can't give you the name of my bank--because I have no bank at the moment.  That was a crude trick.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: They're all crude, when they don't work. Had breakfast?

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: Care for a stroll outside? Beautiful morning. The air is like wine, the sky is a deep blue.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Deep blue? I'd call it grey-blue.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: You must come from pretty far South.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: FLorida?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I've never been to Florida.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: Down below's Stanley Park. On the other side of the trees, there's a beach. You can see it.  Steveston's over there. Coast Guard station.  There's the Yacht Club, and beyond it, the docks. The over on the other side of the inlet, there's Grouse Mountain. It's about 4000 feet high. There's a restaurant on top of it. Very nice restaurant.  I'm sorry we couldn't have met in pleasanter circumstances, Miss Mayfield.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: We wouldn't have met at all.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: True. I was a bit irritable last night. I apologize.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: You were a galahad, compared to some cops I've known.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: You've had dealings with the police before?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Who hasn't--one way or another?

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: But not in the investigation of a major crime, I hope.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Is it a crime?

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: We're 98 per cent certain Mitchell was murdered. There are a lot of reasons.  Was he very drunk when you last saw him?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: You were there when I last saw him.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: I'd like to believe that. It's not too easy.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: I'll find out, you know. Perhaps not today--perhaps not tomorrow. But in the end, I'll find out.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: The police always do, don't they?

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: You've has an experience that you don't want to talk about. An unhappy marriage, for example.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: I wouldn't make you talk about it. My job is the death of Marry Mitchell.  Why can't you give me your confidence?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: You--or the Vancouver Police Department?

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: We try to be decent.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: You're a police officer. A very nice one--but you have a job to do. I'm a girl who's in a jam, and it's your job to keep me there. Don't go considerate on me. I might start to bawl.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: You won't tell me who you are? You won't even give me a chance to help you?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Nobody can help me. You, least of all.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: If I understand what you meant by that.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: You understand perfectly.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: Then there isn't much I can do, is there?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: There isn't anything you can do.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: This isn't a very good place to talk.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I don't want to talk.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: I've come here to arrest you for murder.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I expected nothing else.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: I might be able to save you.  If I knew enough.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: You wouldn't even try  There must be some copper in you, or you wouldn't be an inspector.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: There must be-- but when I'm with you I can't find it.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: I'm about to be very silly.  A man passes a girl on the street--a very lovely girl--his eyes meet her eyes, and something reaches out and takes hold of his heart-- and then she goes on and is lost in the crowd--and he says to himself, "There goes my lost love"-- and it's true--if he never sees her again, it's still true.  Of course, after a while, he forgets-- or almost forgets--because after a while we forget almost everything.  But this man is a copper.  He gets orders--routine orders--to go to a place and investigate a murder-- and everything points to a certain girl.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Points very straight to her.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: He looks at the girl, looks into her eyes--

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: What does he see?

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: Palm trees against a sunset--waves breaking on a coral reef--the Taj Mahal by moonlight--roses in an English garden, just after a shower--  Clich√©s, one and all--but good ones, with a lot of mileage left in them--there's one thing he does not see--murder--and murder was what he was sent to find.  Pretty ridiculous, isn't it?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Very ridiculous.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: That's my hard luck--I'm man enough to tell you about it--and not be sorry.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: What do your friends call you?-- The ones that know you well?--and like you very much?

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: They call me Jeff.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Jeff.  Shall we go now, Jeff, and get it over with?

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: Not quiet yet.  We know who the gun belonged to. Margo West.  She told us this morning.  It doesn't mean much.  Mitchell took it away from her.  He had a habit of going through her bag.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Looking for peanuts, I suppose.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: So Mitchell had handled it. Afterwards, Brandon picked it up.  There's no indication you handled it.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I always wear gloves when I shoot people.  A bad joke--but better than tears.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: Time's up.  I'm off the case.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: They'll only find someone else-- who won't be so kind.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: That's something I can't spare you.  But I won't do it myself.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Because you think your in love with me?

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: I'm enough of a copper to do my duty.  My boss made it tough for me.  If I don't arrest you, I've gone soft.  If I do, it's to save my face.  I don't play those rules.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: You've got a couple of hours, maybe.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: To do what?

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: I can't answer that.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: What will they do to you?

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: That's they're business.  Can I drop you somewhere?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: You're still a police officer, Jeff.  I saw you send those two men away. I know they were watching me.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: What are you going to do--toss your job into Puget Sound?  Because I make you think of magnolias?  I thought policeman was something like a soldier.  That his duty came first.  However much he might happen hate it.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: I've been a soldier too.  There is a difference.  A policeman, like a judge, has a right to disqualify himself on proper grounds.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: What proper grounds?  You can't be in love with me.  You hardly know me.  I'm not in love with you.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: I know that.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: But even if you were in love with me.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: There's an empty taxi across the street.  If you're so anxious, take it.  He'll know the way to the police headquarters.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: You do things the hard way, don't you?

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: Sometimes.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Not sometimes.  Always.  Just because it is the hard way.  You're that kind of man, Jeff.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: Goodbye, Betty.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: He could have killed me a dozen times.  You'd never have known.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: We know everything.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: No, Jeff.  You don't.  He's not a murderer, I tell you.  He;s not a murderer.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: I hope he can prove it.  Come on. You don't want to get pneumonia.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: But I tell you---if you'd only understand.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: I understand, Betty.  I understand perfectly.

turns.speaker: SECRETARY
turns.text: Good morning, Mr. Brandon.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Morning. Any calls?

turns.speaker: SECRETARY
turns.text: Mr. Reed would like you to call him.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: All right. Get him.

turns.speaker: SECRETARY
turns.text: And there's a Mr. Goble to see you. Says his business is personal.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Who's Goble?

turns.speaker: SECRETARY
turns.text: Mr. Reed, please, for Mr.  Brandon.  Very well. Have him call. Mr. Brandon is in his office now.  Mr. Reed stepped out, Mr.  Brandon.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: This way.

turns.speaker: GOBLE
turns.text: I'd like a few words with you, in private.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: I'm not interested in blind dates.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Nice friendly approach you've got. Goble. I could hardly walk when I got out of bed this morning.

turns.speaker: GOBLE
turns.text: You asked for it.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: I'm still asking. What do you want?

turns.speaker: GOBLE
turns.text: I'm not sure I want anything from you. You might want something from me.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Name it.

turns.speaker: GOBLE
turns.text: Information--protection--you might even want to hire me to go home and listen to the radio.  That's the funny part of my business-- once in a while, I get hired not to work.  Nice girl you were with last night. Known her long?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Private eye?

turns.speaker: GOBLE
turns.text: You guessed it. The card's phony. I got plenty of 'em. Different names, different jobs. I work out of San Francisco. Go anywhere, do anything. All it takes is the folding.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: What are your rates?

turns.speaker: GOBLE
turns.text: $40 a day and expenses. Expenses run pretty high on a case like this. I'm a long way from home. I don't have a B.C. Licence. I'd need about $500 for a retainer.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: What have you got on Miss Mayfield?

turns.speaker: GOBLE
turns.text: Mayfield? Oh, that girl you were with last night. You haven't hired me yet. Mr. Brandon.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: That's a nice hard knee you've got, Goble. How'd you like to trade it for a broken neck?

turns.speaker: GOBLE
turns.text: Quit trying to scare me, Mr. Brandon, I'm neurotic.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: I don't know whether to knock your teeth down your throat--or call the police--or just give you twenty bucks to go out and buy yourself a clean nose.

turns.speaker: GOBLE
turns.text: You hurt my feelings. I ought to raise the price to be a thousand.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: If I call the police, your price will go down to a minus sign.

turns.speaker: GOBLE
turns.text: Bluff. You've waited too long.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: For five hundred, what do I get?

turns.speaker: GOBLE
turns.text: I go home and paint the kitchen.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: For two hundred?

turns.speaker: GOBLE
turns.text: I stick around and wait for the five hundred.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: You mentioned information.

turns.speaker: GOBLE
turns.text: Sorry. Another client paid for that. You can hire me not to use it.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: A thousand.

turns.speaker: GOBLE
turns.text: Got it on you?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Got the information on you?

turns.speaker: GOBLE
turns.text: Get it in half an hour.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: There's two hundred. I'll meet you in an hour--where we met last night

turns.speaker: GOBLE
turns.text: Why not here?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: I don't like your perfume in my office. Make it somewhere else if you don't like Charlie's.

turns.speaker: GOBLE
turns.text: Charlie's suits me fine. I don't scare.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Hi Margo. Hello Killaine. You two come together?

turns.speaker: MARGO
turns.text: In the same elevator. It is a public conveyance.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Let me introduce you. Mr.  Killaine, Mrs. West.

turns.speaker: MARGO
turns.text: Fascinated.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: What'll you have, Margo?

turns.speaker: MARGO
turns.text: Martini.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: You, Killaine?

turns.speaker: MARGO
turns.text: You make friends quickly, don't you, Clark?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Sometimes.

turns.speaker: MARGO
turns.text: And without much discrimination.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Leave that one lay.

turns.speaker: MARGO
turns.text: They still hang women in Canada, I've heard.

turns.speaker: MARGO
turns.text: I'm sorry. This thing has just knocked me silly.  How long do we have to wait for this police character?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Until he comes. He's a nice guy. You've met him.

turns.speaker: MARGO
turns.text: That comedian?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: All right, let's see the buzzer.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: What's a buzzer?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: So you're not a cop.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Me a cop? What made you think that, Mr. Brandon?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Who told you my name?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: I've got good ears.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: How are your teeth getting along?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: The new ones are fine. The last set I had gave me all kinds of trouble.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: What's this in favor of?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: I don't like to be tailed. The lady I'm with doesn't like to be stared at. To put the matter in a couple of nutshells, I don't like you.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: A private joke.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: It goes with this... cold houses and warm drinks...the effete Englishman.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: You're not English.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: That's what I like about cocktail parties. Everyone is so perfectly natural.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: How's life treating you?

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: The usual grind.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Round of golf Saturday?

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: If I can get off.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Would it have helped if I'd knocked him down?

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: Hardly. Who's the girl?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Somebody Mitchell picked up on the train. I don't even know her name.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: She doesn't look like a girl who would let herself be picked up on a train.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: That's what I thought, at first.  Maybe somebody else ought to have thrown this party.  With my liquor of course.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Yes, I've seen it before.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: On Miss Mayfield's balcony.. beside the chaise, I picked it up. Don't ask me why. I ought to know better.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: Quite sure you had no motive?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Could be.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: I rather thought so. And before that, had you ever seen the gun?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: It was lying where on the balcony?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Near his right hand. About a foot away. Perhaps more. Good heavens, one doesn't use a tape measure.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: We do, when we get the chance.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: How about a cup of coffee?

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: No thanks. I had some. How would you like to take a walk for, say, half and hour?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: How are you two getting along?

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: Delightfully. Every time Miss Mayfield says something, I know less than I did before.  Well, I may as well knock off for tonight.  Good night, Miss Mayfield. Do let me thank you for your cooperation.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: In case you want to have us followed.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: I don't.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Well--good night.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: Time for a little chat?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: If it doesn't take too long.  Drink?

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: Thanks.  I don't mind.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: Thanks.  Lovely view you have, haven't you?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: I never notice the view after the first week.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: I would.  Fancy waking up every morning with that in your lap.  Wonderful thing, money is.  Remember what Somerset Maugham said about it ?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: I wouldn't know.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: "Money is a sort of sixth sense that gives meaning to all the others." Very appealing, especially to a poor man.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Could we discuss that some other time?

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: Sure.  Let's discuss Betty Mayfield.  How long since you saw her?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: A couple of hours.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: I have a warrant for her arrest.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: That must hurt.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: I've always thought you were a pretty nice guy, Brandon.  I'd like to go on thinking so.  If you tried to help her get away--

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Would that make me a heel?

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: You'd be breaking the law.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Doesn't answer the question.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: The only answer I have for you.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: You passed up a dozen chances to arrest her.  What toughened you up?

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: Information.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Don't kid me.  You don't think she murdered Mitchell.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: It could have been an accident.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: That COULD BE TOLD.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: Not if she knew she wouldn't be believed.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Your concentrating too hard, Killaine.  What about Margo West? She had a motive.  I guess you know by this time whose gun it was?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: And old man Clarendon?  He had a motive, too.  Margo and her money.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: Mitchell was killed down here.  How could Clarendon get in to do it?  Or Margo for that matter.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: How could Mitchell?  After that act he put on up here, is it likely she'd let him in?

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: She didn't have to.  He could have climbed down from here.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Mitchell was too drunk.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: Or just drunk enough.  He was with her when she registered.  He knew where her room was.  You were out most of the evening.  There was a lot of mess to clean up . Waiters coming and going, the door standing open.  Suppose Mitchell came in to grab a drink for himself, then wandered out on this balcony, then realized betty's balcony was just below yours.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Romeo in reverse.  Uh-uh.  No sale, Killaine.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: You don't buy it.  Okay.  So I still want Betty Mayfield.  Where is she?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: No idea.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: No more for me, thanks.  Remember what I said.  I can't interfere with the law.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Where would she go, anyway.  Don't tell me you haven't got her covered.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: You forgetting the gag line, Killaine.  The police don't take anything for granted.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: I'm afraid they do.  Far too often. So long.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Wait a minute.  I'll go with you.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: You do a lot of real estate trading, Brandon?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Now and then.  Mostly just for the fun of it.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: I tried it once.  I lost my shirt.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: I buy my shirts by the dozen. Fortunately.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: Where did it all come from?  Or is that a permissible question?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: I had a father who knew how to steal.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: You asked me where it all came from.

turns.speaker: KILLAINE
turns.text: Oh.  That was just one of those idle questions.  One doesn't expect an answer.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Hello, Mitchell. Having fun?

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: The liquors lovely. The rest of the party you can have.

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: What's the matter, baby. Don't you like me anymore?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Lay off, can't you?

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: Lay off what? This is my new girl friend. Met her on the train. She's very fond of me. Love at first sight. Wasn't it, baby?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Do me a favor, Mitchell. Find yourself a nice secluded park bench.

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: Did I do something wrong?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: I wouldn't know. Just do it somewhere else. There is such a thing as good manners.

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: How would you know, Brandon?

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Want to walk out... or get thrown out?

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: You don't throw guests out, Brandon.

turns.speaker: BRANDON
turns.text: Don't bet on it. I'm eccentric.

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: Good afternoon, Mr. Campbell.

turns.speaker: CAMPBELL
turns.text: Mr. Mitchell.

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: A little something on account perhaps?

turns.speaker: CAMPBELL
turns.text: Rather more than a little something, Mr. Mitchell.

turns.speaker: MITCHELL
turns.text: I'm afraid this is all for the moment.
